Flowers are the
moment’s representations
of things that are in
themselves eternal.
(Sri Aurobindo, CWSA 35: 445 )

Flowers are
extremely receptive.
The Mother, CWM 6:229

The flowers indicate
always an opening
(usually psychic) in some
part of the consciousness.
-Sri Aurobindo, CWSA, 30:178

When you see a flower, do
you ask the gardener to
reduce the flower to its
chemical components?
There would then be no
flower left and no beauty.
Sri Aurobindo, CWSA 27: 254

If your aspiration is strong
your flower-offerings
will be fresh.
The Mother, CWM, 03:132

Bindu Popli creates art that comes from a place
deep within her. She has a BFA degree in
painting from Delhi College of Art where she
received several prestigious awards and
scholarships. Her work has been shown in several
solo and joint exhibitions, where it received high
reviews and acclaim. She currently heads Art
Department at a public school in Delhi.
With a deepening of her inner journey, her art has
increasingly become an expression of the truth
within her.
